snippet.title: Sapphire Wellness Watch
snippet.description: The $320 Sapphire Wellness Watch doesn't come cheap but this sophisticated timepiece tracks how fast your heart races, and the steps you take with crystal and metal-coated flair.

snippet.title: The smart, premium style of the Sapphire Wellness Watch (pictures)
snippet.description: Outfitted with a heart rate monitor, pedometer, Bluetooth syncing, plus a quartz crystal-coated screen, the Wellograph Sapphire wows with style and fitness function.

snippet.title: Wellograph's sleek new Sapphire Wellness Watch sparkles with style at CES 2014
snippet.description: Offering heart rate monitoring and step measuring skills in an elegantly crafted package, the new Sapphire Wellness Watch from Wellograph aims to merge style with powerful fitness tracking.

snippet.title: Airbnb to collect hotel taxes in San Francisco
snippet.description: Starting this summer, the online vacation rental service plans to collect and remit taxes on behalf of hosts.

snippet.title: Google+ Local hotel listings commandeered
snippet.description: For unknown reasons, more than 3,000 hotel Web site listings on Google+ Local now point to third-party booking sites.

snippet.title: Finally, someone wants to ease the pain of booking a hotel
snippet.description: Traxo, which fancies itself as the world's most powerful personal travel manager, now says it knows exactly where you want to stay. Because it cares. Yes, like Scarlett Johannson in "Her."

snippet.title: Glasshole heaven: Hotel offers free drink if you wear Glass
snippet.description: San Francisco's Stanford Court Hotel wants to attract the techie crowd. So Google Glass wearers get a free drink. There must be a catch, right? Well, a small one.

snippet.title: Unlock your hotel room door with your cell phone
snippet.description: Lose your hotel key card? Did it accidentally get demagnetized? Well, there's a new, high-tech way to get into your room: mobile keys that let guests unlock their doors with their cell phones. CNET's Kara Tsuboi reports.

snippet.title: Peace, quiet, and a love hotel for your soul in New York
snippet.description: An app called Breather is like AirBnB for a peaceful corner of a big city. It uses space in office buildings that can be rented by the hour.

snippet.title: Cheers to the aliens: Sci-Fi Hotel, Giger Bar coming to US?
snippet.description: Sci-Fi Hotel founder Andy Davies teams up with "Alien" artist H.R. Giger to open a hotel bar, yet where it will land is still unknown.
